entities.name: uncle vernon
entities.description: Uncle Vernon is described as being in a very good mood, trying to start a fire, and thinking nobody will reach them to deliver post. He is also mentioned as having rations of crisps and bananas.

entities.name: aunt petunia
entities.description: Aunt Petunia is described as finding mouldy blankets in the second room and making up a bed for Dudley on the moth-eaten sofa.

entities.name: dudley
entities.description: Dudley is mentioned as being given a bed by Aunt Petunia on the moth-eaten sofa.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is described as privately agreeing with Uncle Vernon that nobody will reach them to deliver post, but it doesnâ€™t cheer him up at all.

entities.name: the broken-down house
entities.description: The broken-down house is described as being horrible inside, smelling strongly of seaweed, and having a damp and empty fireplace.

relationships.description: Uncle Vernon and Harry agree that nobody will reach them to deliver post.
Aunt Petunia makes up a bed for Dudley on the moth-eaten sofa.
